reasoning: Selective mutism affects 0.7-1.4% of general population with peak incidence in childhood (ages 4-18). Lifetime prevalence estimated at 8 per 1000 (0.8%). Condition often persists into adulthood with varying severity. Aggregate estimate combining childhood peak plus lower adult prevalence.
source: Kumisaki T et al. Selective Mutism: A Review and Integration of the Last 15 Years of Research. Clin Psychol Rev. 2010; 30(8):993-1002; Kumpulainen K. Epidemiology and recognition of selective mutism. Eur Child Adolesc Psychiatry. 2002; 11(6):258-265
